title: [DOC] - Feedback on forecasting tutorials
body:
#### Describe the issue linked to the documentation

<!--
Tell us about the confusion introduced in the documentation.
-->

Hi - Just posting some feedback on the two forecasting tutorials linked to issue #1447

Overall I think both of the tutorials are great, I just a have a few minor suggestions for improvements and thoughts I had while reading. 

For `01_forecasting`
- My first impression is that there is a lot of detail, and although the detail is very useful, for new users of the package and new forecasters it might be useful to split off some of the core parts of Section 1 into a slimmed down version, e.g. `01_forecasting_quickstart`.
  - This could contain for example the essential parts of "basic deployment workflow: batch fitting and forecasting" and "basic evaluation workflow: evaluating a batch of forecasts against ground truth observations"
- Section 1.3. It might be useful to invite contributions for a separate vignette/example on the advanced use cases of the evaluation class which could be linked to here? (parameter modification, custom metric composition, tuning over metric parameters)
- Section 3.1. For me, it wasn't really clear what the other reduction strategies are, is this documented somewhere for further reading? "In the above example we use the "recursive" reduction strategy. Other implemented strategies are.."
- Section 3.2. Is there a `normaliser` component for the pipelining? This could be useful for (e.g.) renewables forecasting where you have (user defined) changes in capacity of wind farm, region, solar park, etc
- Section 3.4.1. Would it be more clear to include `seasonal="additive"` in the exponential smoothing model to link with the examples shown previously? 

I made a few more minor changes to `01a_forecasting` and `01a_forecasting` in PR #2114 

I hope this is useful!
